Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: Patient is experiencing increased anxiety, particularly related to the upcoming arrival of a baby, and is struggling to manage these feelings
History of Present Illness (HPI): Patient reports anxiety triggered by thoughts about parenting and finances. They have been practicing breathing exercises and have found some temporary relief but continue to feel anxious. They also express feelings of inadequacy as a provider
Psychosocial History: Patient has a supportive wife who helps them cope with anxiety through communication
Current Functional Status: Patient is actively engaging in coping strategies and has discussed their feelings with their wife, which has been beneficial
Progress Evaluation: Patient feels more hopeful about managing their anxiety and is open to setting goals for improvement
Therapeutic Interventions: Plan to create a budget with their wife and explore freelance work in advertising to alleviate financial pressure
Next Steps: Goals include scheduling time to create a budget and reaching out to contacts for freelance opportunities
